description: The suit alleges that Musk and his super PAC are luring voters to give up identifying information in pursuit of a cash prize. DA Larry Krasner called the scheme “indisputably an unlawful lottery.”
title: Philadelphia DA sues Elon Musk over $1 million giveaway to registered voters

description: Japan is the only country where married couples are required to use one surname or family name.  Most often it's women who give up their surname and women's rights advocates have fought for decades for the right to use different surnames in marriage. And now proponents are using a new argument to make their point.
title: A Fight Over Identity in Japan

description: Federal officials have been warning that in recent months, some social media users have been encouraging sabotage of ballot drop boxes. "It's a direct attack on democracy," said one local official.
title: Ballots set on fire in three states as Election Day approaches

description: Egypt has a new cease-fire proposal amid Israel’s bombardment and siege of northern Gaza. Israel is discussing the proposal but waiting to see who is elected U.S. president, an official told NPR.
title: Israel awaits the U.S. election before a Gaza cease-fire, an official says

description: The statue was months in the making. Upon its unveiling Sunday, fans suggested it looks more like former professional boxer George Foreman and Matrix actor Laurence Fishburne.
title: New Dwyane Wade statue honors the NBA star. But some fans say it misses the mark

description: Journalist Eliza Griswold says complaints about homophobia, white privilege and diversity are splintering progressive organizations — including one particular church. Her book is Circle of Hope.
title: How culture wars divided one small progressive church in Philadelphia

description: Dragon Age: The Veilguard has superb combat and companions but if you're hoping for a return to the series' origins, you'll be disappointed.
title: Tonally inconsistent ‘Dragon Age: The Veilguard’ is still BioWare’s best action game

description: Dustin Kjersem was found dead in his tent earlier this month of what was first thought to be a possible bear attack. Investigators have ruled it a homicide, saying he died of "multiple chop wounds."
title: Montana camper found dead was killed — but not by a bear, authorities say

description: Harris’ plan for Puerto Rico's economy boosted after racist remarks made at Trump rally last night. And, the Yankees look for a World Series comeback after losing the first two games to the Dodgers.
title: Remarks made at Trump rally backfires. And, Yankees aim for World Series comeback

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to former "Washington Post" Executive Editor Marty Baron about the paper's decision not to endorse a presidential candidate.
title: 'Washington Post' decides not to endorse a presidential candidate

description: Talisay, about 43 miles south of Manila, was one of several towns ravaged by Tropical Storm Trami, the deadliest of 11 storms to hit the Philippines this year.
title: More than 150 dead or missing from massive flooding and landslides in the Philippines

description: McDonald’s says Quarter Pounders will return to its menu at all of its restaurants after it said testing ruled out beef patties as the source of an E. coli poisoning outbreak tied to the burgers.
title: McDonald's will begin selling its Quarter Pounders again amid E. coli outbreak

description: After-school activities will still be suspended Monday and Tuesday.
title: Schools in Asheville are reopening in the aftermath of Hurricane Helene

description: In Pennsylvania — a pivotal state in this year's tight election — Puerto Ricans wield significant clout. A comedian at a Trump rally called Puerto Rico a "floating island of garbage."
title: Bad Bunny boosts Harris as a Puerto Rico ‘joke’ backfires on Trump
